item.name: Air
item.description: Air is a technical block. It can not be obtained but can be used with commands like /setblock to remove blocks from the world.

item.name: Stone
item.description: Stone is found naturaly in maps and can also be created by smelting Cobblestone in a Furnace. When Stone is mined it drops Cobblestone. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Stone.

item.name: Grass
item.description: Grass is one of the most common blocks on the surfaces of maps. Grass is nearly identical to Dirt, with the main difference being that it can not be picked up by the player and placed. Dirt/Grass is required for plants like Saplings to grow. Grass doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so its useful for creating building foundations. When Grass is destroyed Dirt is dropped, there is also a small chance that a Bone will be dropped. When Bonemeal is used on Grass a Tall Grass will be created on top of it.

item.name: Dirt
item.description: Dirt is one of the most common blocks on the surfaces of maps. Dirt/Grass is required for plants like Saplings to grow. Dirt doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so its useful for creating building foundations. Grass grows ontop of Dirt if it has sunlight falling on it and a Grass block next to it. When Dirt is destroyed Dirt is dropped, there is also a small chance that a Bone will be dropped.

item.name: Coarse Dirt
item.description: Dirt is one of the most common blocks on the surfaces of maps. Dirt/Grass is required for plants like Saplings to grow. Dirt doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so its useful for creating building foundations. Grass grows ontop of Dirt if it has sunlight falling on it and a Grass block next to it. When Dirt is destroyed Dirt is dropped, there is also a small chance that a Bone will be dropped.

item.name: Podzol
item.description: Podzol is the form of Dirt found in Redwood Forrest biomes. Grass can not grow on Podzol like it can on Dirt. When it is destroyed a Dirt block is dropped.

item.name: Cobblestone
item.description: Cobblestones can be obtained from mining Stone and can be found in Dungeons. When Water and Lava touch they produce Cobblestone. Cobblestones are mainly used in constructions of buildings and paths. Using a Furnace you can turn Cobblestone back into Stone. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Cobblestone.

item.name: Wooden Plank (Oak)
item.description: Wooden Planks are generaly used as a building material, but can also be used in Furnaces as a source of fuel. Planks will burn if near fire or Lava.

item.name: Wooden Plank (Spruce)
item.description: Wooden Planks are generaly used as a building material, but can also be used in Furnaces as a source of fuel. Planks will burn if near fire or Lava.

item.name: Wooden Plank (Birch)
item.description: Wooden Planks are generaly used as a building material, but can also be used in Furnaces as a source of fuel. Planks will burn if near fire or Lava.

item.name: Wooden Plank (Jungle)
item.description: Wooden Planks are generaly used as a building material, but can also be used in Furnaces as a source of fuel. Planks will burn if near fire or Lava.

item.name: Wooden Plank (Acacia)
item.description: Wooden Planks are generaly used as a building material, but can also be used in Furnaces as a source of fuel. Planks will burn if near fire or Lava.

item.name: Wooden Plank (Dark Oak)
item.description: Wooden Planks are generaly used as a building material, but can also be used in Furnaces as a source of fuel. Planks will burn if near fire or Lava.

item.name: Sapling (Oak)
item.description: Saplings are young Trees. They require dirt under them and light (Either Sunlight or Torches) to grow. They won't grow if there is no room above them. After a few days Saplings turn into Trees which can then be harvested for Logs and Saplings. Bone Meal can be used on a Sapling to cause it to instantly grow into a Tree. There are four types of Saplings: Oak, Pine, Birch and Jungle.

item.name: Sapling (Spruce)
item.description: Saplings are young Trees. They require dirt under them and light (Either Sunlight or Torches) to grow. They won't grow if there is no room above them. After a few days Saplings turn into Trees which can then be harvested for Logs and Saplings. Bone Meal can be used on a Sapling to cause it to instantly grow into a Tree. There are four types of Saplings: Oak, Pine, Birch and Jungle.

There are four types of Saplings: Oak, Pine, Birch and Jungle.

item.name: Bedrock
item.description: Bedrock can not be picked up or placed by the player. It marks the edges of the map and is an invincible block designed to prevent the player from falling out of the world.

item.name: Water
item.description: Water is generaly found on the surface of maps but it can also be found underground. Water can spread, so destroying blocks in its path will allow water to "Grow". Water can be transported by Buckets and placed in a different location. If Water touches a Lava source, it will turn into Obsidian. If it touches Lava which isn't a source it will turn into Cobblestone. Water can extinguish Fire, making it an ideal place to jump into if your on Fire.

item.name: Water (No Spread)
item.description: Water is generaly found on the surface of maps but it can also be found underground. Water can spread, so destroying blocks in its path will allow water to "Grow". Water can be transported by Buckets and placed in a different location. If Water touches a Lava source, it will turn into Obsidian. If it touches Lava which isn't a source it will turn into Cobblestone. Water can extinguish Fire, making it an ideal place to jump into if your on Fire.

item.name: Lava
item.description: Lava is generaly found deep underground. Lava can spread, so destroying blocks in its path will allow Lava to "Grow". Lava can be transported by Buckets and placed in a different location. If a Lava source touches Water, it will turn into Obsidian. If the Lava isn't a source it will turn into Cobblestone. Lava can set objects near it on Fire when it throws bits of Lava into the air (The player can not be set on fire by what the Lava throws into the air). Unplaced objects that touch Lava are destroyed on contact making it a great place to dispose of unwanted items. Flamable objects (Including the player) which come into direct contact with Lava will be set on Fire.

item.name: Lava (No Spread)
item.description: Lava is generaly found deep underground. Lava can spread, so destroying blocks in its path will allow Lava to "Grow". Lava can be transported by Buckets and placed in a different location. If a Lava source touches Water, it will turn into Obsidian. If the Lava isn't a source it will turn into Cobblestone. Lava can set objects near it on Fire when it throws bits of Lava into the air (The player can not be set on fire by what the Lava throws into the air). Unplaced objects that touch Lava are destroyed on contact making it a great place to dispose of unwanted items. Flamable objects (Including the player) which come into direct contact with Lava will be set on Fire.

item.name: Sand
item.description: Sand a common block found near water. Sand falls when there are no blocks under it but Torches can be used to support Sand blocks. Sand can be smelted in a Furnace to produce Glass. Cactuses require sand under them to grow.

item.name: Red Sand
item.description: Sand a common block found near water. Sand falls when there are no blocks under it but Torches can be used to support Sand blocks. Sand can be smelted in a Furnace to produce Glass. Cactuses require sand under them to grow.

item.name: Gravel
item.description: Gravel a common block generaly found near water or underground. Gravel falls when there are no blocks under it but Torches can be used to support Gravel blocks.

item.name: Gold Ore
item.description: After mined Gold Ore needs to be smelted in a Furnace to create Gold Ingots. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Gold Ore.

item.name: Iron Ore
item.description: After mined Iron Ore needs to be smelted in a Furnace to create Iron Ingots. A Stone Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Iron Ore.

item.name: Coal Ore
item.description: When mined, Coal Ore drops one lump of Coal. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Coal Ore.

item.name: Wood (Oak)
item.description: Wood can be obtained by attacking Trees. Axes can be used to obtain Wood faster. Wood is generaly crafted into Wooden Planks but can be used as both a building material as well as a Fuel for a Furnace. Logs will burn if near fire or Lava. There are four types of Wood, Oak, Pine, Birch and Jungle.

Wood is generaly crafted into Wooden Planks but can be used as both a building material as well as a Fuel for a Furnace. Logs will burn if near fire or Lava. There are four types of Wood, Oak, Pine, Birch and Jungle.

item.name: Leaves (Oak)
item.description: Leaves can be obtained using Shears on Leaf Blocks of a Tree. They grow when a Sapling turns into a Tree. Destroying Leaves can cause Saplings to drop. Apples have a low chance of dropping when Leaves are destroyed(Birch, Spruce and Jungle Leaves do not drop Apples).

item.name: Leaves (Spruce)
item.description: Leaves can be obtained using Shears on Leaf Blocks of a Tree. They grow when a Sapling turns into a Tree. Destroying Leaves can cause Saplings to drop. Apples have a low chance of dropping when Leaves are destroyed(Birch, Spruce and Jungle Leaves do not drop Apples).

item.name: Leaves (Birch)
item.description: Leaves can be obtained using Shears on Leaf Blocks of a Tree. They grow when a Sapling turns into a Tree. Destroying Leaves can cause Saplings to drop. Apples have a low chance of dropping when Leaves are destroyed(Birch, Spruce and Jungle Leaves do not drop Apples).

item.name: Leaves (Jungle)
item.description: Leaves can be obtained using Shears on Leaf Blocks of a Tree. They grow when a Sapling turns into a Tree. Destroying Leaves can cause Saplings to drop. Apples have a low chance of dropping when Leaves are destroyed(Birch, Spruce and Jungle Leaves do not drop Apples).

item.name: Sponge
item.description: Sponge blocks were used to prevent Water from entering an area around it in Minecraft Classic and Infdev. In version 1.8 Sponge and Wet Sponge were added to survival.

item.name: Wet Sponge
item.description: A Wet Sponge is a Sponge that has absorbed water. It needs to be placed in a Furnace to turn it back into a Sponge

item.name: Glass
item.description: Glass is a manmade substance that is not naturaly found in maps. It is created by smelting Sand in a Furnace. Glass doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so it can be used to create Bridges. Light is not effected by Glass and passes right through it.

item.name: Lapis Lazuli Ore
item.description: When mined, Lapis Lazuli Ore drops one lump of Lapis Lazuli. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Lapis Lazuli Ore.

item.name: Lapis Lazuli Block
item.description: Lapis Lazuli Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They are generaly used for Decoration or for storing Lapis Lazulis. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Lapis Lazuli Blocks.

item.name: Dispenser
item.description: Dispensers shoot objects like Arrows and throw out other items placed in them when they are triggered by a redstone current. They can be used as defence against Mobs by placing Arrows inside of them and having pressure plates activate the Dispenser.

item.name: Sandstone
item.description: Sandstones are used in the construction of buildings, walls and paths. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Sandstone.

item.name: Sandstone (Chiseled)
item.description: Sandstones are used in the construction of buildings, walls and paths. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Sandstone.

item.name: Sandstone (Smooth)
item.description: Sandstones are used in the construction of buildings, walls and paths. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Sandstone.

item.name: Note Block
item.description: Note Blocks play a note(Sound) when they are hit or are triggered by a redstone current. You can change the note thats played by right clicking on the Note Block.

item.name: Bed (Block)
item.description: Beds allow the player to sleep until the morning. They can only be used at night. In a multiplayer server only if all players are in a bed will the servers time change to morning. Sleeping in a bed changes your respawn point to the beds location.

item.name: Rail (Powered)
item.description: Powered Rails are used to either boost a Minecarts speed or to slow it down. When the Powered Rail has a Redstone Current going through it, Minecarts traveling over it will have the speed boosted, when no current is going through it Minecarts will be slowed down.If one side of a Powered Rail is blocked and power is running through it, Minecarts placed on it will move at speed in the opposite direction of the Block.

item.name: Rail (Detector)
item.description: Detector Rails act like Stone Pressure Plates but are only triggered by Minecarts. When a Minecart moves over it, it will power blocks adjacent to it.

item.name: Sticky Piston
item.description: Sticky Pistons push or pull the block infront of them when toggled. They can not push or pull Blocks with special properties such as Chests.

item.name: Cobweb
item.description: You can find Cobwebs naturaly in Abandoned Mines. Webs slow players/Mobs that move inside of it. When destroyed String is dropped.

item.name: Tall Grass (Dead Shrub)
item.description: Tall Grass grows ontop of grass Blocks. When you destroy Tall Grass there is a chance that Seeds will be dropped. You can obtain them by using Shears on them.

item.name: Tall Grass
item.description: Tall Grass grows ontop of grass Blocks. When you destroy Tall Grass there is a chance that Seeds will be dropped. You can obtain them by using Shears on them.

item.name: Tall Grass (Fern)
item.description: Tall Grass grows ontop of grass Blocks. When you destroy Tall Grass there is a chance that Seeds will be dropped. You can obtain them by using Shears on them.

item.name: Dead Shrub
item.description: Dead Shrubs can be found naturaly ontop of Sand Blocks. They currently have no use.

item.name: Piston
item.description: Pistons push other Blocks when activated. They can not push Blocks with special properties such as Chests.

item.name: Piston (Head)
item.description: Pistons push other Blocks when activated. They can not push Blocks with special properties such as Chests.

item.name: Wool
item.description: Wool can be obtained by shearing Sheep. Its currently only used in crafting Paintings.

item.name: Orange Wool
item.description: Orange Wool can be obtained by shearing Orange Sheep. Its currently only used in crafting Paintings.

item.name: Red Wool
item.description: Red Wool can be obtained by shearing Red Sheep. Its currently only used in crafting Paintings.

item.name: Black Wool
item.description: Black Wool can be obtained from sheering Black Sheep.

item.name: Piston (Moving)
item.description: Pistons push other Blocks when activated. They can not push Blocks with special properties such as Chests.

item.name: Dandelion
item.description: Dandelions are used in the creation of Dandelion Yellow Dye.

item.name: Poppy
item.description: Poppys are used to create Rose Red Dye.

item.name: Brown Mushroom
item.description: Brown Mushrooms are used in creating Mushroom Stew. Mushrooms are generaly found in low light areas such as caves. Mushrooms will spread slowly in low light conditions, so can be farmed. When Bonemeal is used on a Brown Mushroom it will turn into a Giant Brown Mushroom made out of Brown Mushroom (Block)s.

item.name: Red Mushroom
item.description: Red Mushrooms are used in creating Mushroom Stew. Mushrooms are generaly found in low light areas such as caves. Mushrooms will spread slowly in low light conditions, so can be farmed. When Bonemeal is used on a Red Mushroom it will turn into a Giant Red Mushroom made out of Red Mushroom (Block)s.

item.name: Block of Gold
item.description: Gold Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They are generaly used for Decoration or for storing Gold Ingots. They can be crafted back into Gold Ingots. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Gold Blocks.

item.name: Block of Iron
item.description: Iron Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They are generaly used for Decoration or for storing Iron Ingots. A Stone Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Iron Blocks.

item.name: Stone Slab (Double)
item.description: Stone Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wood Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.description: Sandstone Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wood Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.description: Brick Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wood Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Stone Brick Slab
item.description: Stone Brick Slab allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wood Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Nether Brick Slab
item.description: Nether Brick Slab allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wood Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Quartz Slab
item.description: Quartz Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Quartz Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Brick
item.description: Brick is a man made substance which can not be found naturaly in the world. It is generaly used for the walls of buildings. A Wood Pickaxe is required to break Brick.

item.name: TNT
item.description: TNT is a placeable explosive. Its countdown is activated by Fire touching it or a Redstone current. The countdown can not be stoped once activated. Obsidian and Bedrock can not be destroyed by TNT.

item.name: Bookshelf
item.description: Bookcases are a decorative block which currently serves no other purpose.

item.name: Moss Stone
item.description: Moss Stone is only found in Dungeons. It is generaly used as the wall for the Dungeons. It can be obtained by using a Wood Pickaxe or higher.

item.name: Obsidian
item.description: Obsidian is created when a Lava source is touched by Water. Obsidian can not be destroyed by TNT. Only a Diamond Pickaxe can be used to break Obsidian.

item.name: Torch
item.description: Torches are mainly used to light up buildings as well as mines. Enemy Mobs can only spawn in dark locations, so using Torches around your buildings is advised. Torches can support the weight of blocks like Sand and Gravel when they are placed above them.

item.name: Fire
item.description: Fire is created using Flint and Steel on a flamable block. It is also created by Lava igniting flamable blocks. Fire can spread to flamable blocks that are near to it. Mobs or players touching Fire will be set on Fire. Water can put Fire out.

item.name: Mob Spawner
item.description: Mob Spawners are at the heart of Dungeons. They spawn Mobs inside the Dungeon. Mob Spawners can be destroyed by the player but they can not be picked up. Traps can be placed around the Mob Spawner to kill Mobs that are spawned (Such as drowning them) so that what they drop can be harvested.Skeletons, Spiders and Zombies can be spawned from Mob Spawners found naturaly in the world. A Mob Spawner can only spawn one type of Mob.

item.name: Wooden Stairs (Oak)
item.description: Wooden Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Chest
item.description: Chests allow players to store items. If two chests are placed beside each other they become a large chest. Chests can not be opened if a block is placed above them.

item.name: Redstone Wire
item.description: Redstone Wires are like Electric cables. They allow you to connect objects together like Stone Buttons and Iron Doors. When power is flowing through the Wires they will glow and emit light.

item.name: Diamond Ore
item.description: After being mined, Diamond Ore does not need to be smelted. Diamond Gems are droped when mined and can be used instantly to craft items. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Diamond Ore.

item.name: Block of Diamond
item.description: Diamond Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They are generaly used for Decoration or for storing Diamond Gems. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Diamond Blocks.

item.name: Workbench
item.description: Workbenches give you access to a 3x3 crafting grid. It is required to craft some of the more advanced items. To use a Workbench right click on it.

item.name: Wheat (Crop)
item.description: Wheat is grown by sowing Wheat Seeds. Wheats used to create Bread and Cakes. When Wheat is harvested it has a chance of droping Wheat Seeds. When holding Wheat near by animals will gather around the player. Wheat can be used on animals to make them breed.

item.name: Farmland
item.description: Farmland is a Block of Dirt/Grass which has been Tilled using a Wood Hoe or greater. Wheat Seeds, Melon Seeds and Pumpkin Seeds can only be planted on Farmland. If you or Mobs walk over Farmland too much then it will turn into Dirt and any Wheat growing on it will be destroyed. You can use the "Sneak" key (Default: Shift) to prevent Farmland from being destroyed when you walk over it. Farmland can either be wet or dry depending on if Water is within 5 Blocks of it. Wet Farmland grows crops faster.

item.name: Furnace
item.description: Furnaces allow players to smelt ores and cook food. They emit light when in use. Coal, Logs and Wooden Planks are mainly used as Fuel, which is required to smelt items.

item.name: Furnace (Smelting)
item.description: Furnaces allow players to smelt ores and cook food. They emit light when in use. Coal, Logs and Wooden Planks are mainly used as Fuel, which is required to smelt items.

item.name: Sign (Block)
item.description: Signs are a decorative item that allows you to place a Sign with a custom message in the world. If you are looking at the ground when you place the Sign, it will have a pole. If you are looking at a wall when you place it, it will become a wall mounted Sign. Signs are mainly used in Multiplayer to inform other players where places are or to inform people who buildings belong to.

item.name: Wood Door (Block)
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Ladder
item.description: Ladders allow you to climb blocks vertically or horizontally. Ladders stop water from passing through the area they occupy, so they can be used to create underwater mine entrances. You only need to place Ladders every other block to be able to climb up them, this allows you to save materials.

item.name: Rail
item.description: Rails are used to guide Minecarts around the world. Minecarts can not move without a track.

item.name: Cobblestone Stairs
item.description: Cobblestone Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Sign (Wall Block)
item.description: Signs are a decorative item that allows you to place a Sign with a custom message in the world. If you are looking at the ground when you place the Sign, it will have a pole. If you are looking at a wall when you place it, it will become a wall mounted Sign. Signs are mainly used in Multiplayer to inform other players where places are or to inform people who buildings belong to.

item.name: Lever
item.description: Levers can be used to activate objects like Iron Doors and Redstone Wires. They have two states, on and off. Levers can be switched by Left Clicking on them.

item.name: Stone Pressure Plate
item.description: Stone Pressure Plates can be used to activate objects like Iron Doors and Redstone Wires. They activate objects for about 1-2 seconds. Stone Pressure Plates are activated by standing on them.

item.name: Iron Door (Block)
item.description: Iron Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on an Iron Door does not change its open/closed state. The only way to open or close an iron door is via Levers, Stone Buttons, Wood Pressure Plate, Stone Pressure Plates and Redstone Torchs.

item.name: Wooden Pressure Plate
item.description: Wooden Pressure Plates can be used to activate objects like Iron Doors and Redstone Wires. They activate objects for about 1-2 seconds. Wood Pressure Plates are activated by standing on them.

item.name: Redstone Ore
item.description: Redstone Ore is generaly found deep underground. When its hit, it emits light. When mined it drops 4 Redstone Dusts. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Redstone Ore.

item.name: Redstone Ore (Glowing)
item.description: Redstone Ore is generaly found deep underground. When its hit, it emits light. When mined it drops 4 Redstone Dusts. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Redstone Ore.

item.name: Redstone Torch (Off)
item.description: Redstone Torches are a source of power simmiler to electricity. They can be used to activate objects and to power Redstone Wires.

item.name: Redstone Torch
item.description: Redstone Torches are a source of power simmiler to electricity. They can be used to activate objects and to power Redstone Wires.

item.name: Button (Stone)
item.description: Stone Buttons can be used to activate objects like Iron Doors and Redstone Wires. They activate objects for about 1-2 seconds. Stone Buttons can be pressed by Left Clicking on them.

item.name: Snow
item.description: Snow forms on top of Blocks which are in a Snow biodome. If destroyed using a shovel it will drop Snowballs.

item.name: Ice
item.description: Ice forms only in freezing biodomes. When Ice is destroyed Water takes its place. Heat sources such as Torches and Lava can melt Ice.

item.name: Snow Block
item.description: Snow blocks are found naturaly in freezing biodomes. They can be used as a building material. 4 Snowballs are dropped when the block is destroyed with a Wood Shovel or Higher.

item.name: Cactus
item.description: Cactus require sand under them and light (Either Sunlight or Torches) to grow. They won't grow if there is no room above them. Cactuses can grow to 3 blocks high. Cactuses half a heart of damage the player on contact and destroys any item that touches them. When harvesting its advisable to destroy the bottom Cactus block so that the blocks above won't get destroyed when they touch the bottom block.

item.name: Clay Block
item.description: Clay blocks are usualy found near Sand. When destroyed they drop 4 Clay balls.

item.name: Sugar Cane (Block)
item.description: Sugar Cane require dirt under them and water beside them. They won't grow if there is no room above them. Sugar Canes can grow to 3 blocks high. If the lowest part of the Sugar Cane is destroyed the Sugar Cane above will also be destroyed allowing for quicker harvesting.

item.name: Jukebox
item.description: Jukebox's allow you to play Music Disks. To play a Music Disk you need to Right Click on the Jukebox while you have a Music Disk equiped. To eject the Music Disk Right Click on the Jukebox. Music Disks do not loop, so you need to eject and re-insert to play it again.

item.name: Pumpkin
item.description: Pumpkins are found naturaly around the world. They can not be grown by the player. Pumpkins can be worn by the player as a helmet but it gives no armor benefits. When worn they prevent Endermen from attacking when you look at them.

item.name: Netherrack
item.description: Netherrack is a very common block in The Nether. When its set on Fire it will burn forever unless put out by the player. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Netherrack.

item.name: Soul Sand
item.description: Soul Sand is only found in The Nether. It slows the player down when walked on.

item.name: Glowstone
item.description: Glowstone is found on the underside of blocks in The Nether. It emits light like a Torch but unlike Torches it can be placed underwater. Glowstone drops 3 Glowstone Dust when broken.

item.name: Portal
item.description: Portals are created by the player and allow travel to and from The Nether. Portals can be created by creating a frame out of Obsidian (4 Wide and 5 Tall) and then using Flint and Steel in the middle of the frame.To travel you need to stand in the middle of the portal for about 2 seconds.

item.name: Jack-O-Lantern
item.description: Jack-O-Lantern are a haloween styed light source. They are like Torches except that they can be placed underwater.

item.name: Cake (Block)
item.description: Cake can only be eaten once it has been placed on the ground by Right Clicking. Once placed the player can eat 6 slices of Cake which reduces hunger by 1 each time. It reduces hunger by 6 when fully consumed.

item.name: Redstone Repeater (Block Off)
item.description: Redstone Repeater's are designed to repeat the current they recieve. They remove the need to use two not gates to extend a redstone current. They only accept input from one side.

item.name: Redstone Repeater (Block On)
item.description: Redstone Repeater's are designed to repeat the current they recieve. They remove the need to use two not gates to extend a redstone current. They only accept input from one side.

item.name: Stained Glass (White)
item.description: Glass is a manmade substance that is not naturaly found in maps. It is created by smelting Sand in a Furnace. Glass doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so it can be used to create Bridges. Light is not effected by Glass and passes right through it. Stained Glass is created by dying Glass with various Dyes.

item.name: Stained Glass (Orange)
item.description: Glass is a manmade substance that is not naturaly found in maps. It is created by smelting Sand in a Furnace. Glass doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so it can be used to create Bridges. Light is not effected by Glass and passes right through it. Stained Glass is created by dying Glass with various Dyes.

Stained Glass is created by dying Glass with various Dyes.

Stained Glass is created by dying Glass with various Dyes.

item.name: Stained Glass (Black)
item.description: Glass is a manmade substance that is not naturaly found in maps. It is created by smelting Sand in a Furnace. Glass doesn't fall when there are no blocks under it so it can be used to create Bridges. Light is not effected by Glass and passes right through it. Stained Glass is created by dying Glass with various Dyes.

item.name: Trapdoor
item.description: Trapdoors work like Wood Doors except that they open upwards. Unlike doors they only take up 1 block in size. Clicking on the Trapdoor will toggle if its open or closed. Trapdoors can be activated by redstone. Water/Lava can not pass through Trapdoors.

item.name: Monster Egg (Stone)
item.description: Monster Egg Blocks spawn a Silverfish when they are destroyed.

item.name: Monster Egg (Cobblestone)
item.description: Monster Egg Blocks spawn a Silverfish when they are destroyed.

item.name: Monster Egg (Stone Brick)
item.description: Monster Egg Blocks spawn a Silverfish when they are destroyed.

item.name: Monster Egg (Mossy Stone Brick)
item.description: Monster Egg Blocks spawn a Silverfish when they are destroyed.

item.name: Monster Egg (Cracked Stone)
item.description: Monster Egg Blocks spawn a Silverfish when they are destroyed.

item.name: Monster Egg (Chiseled Stone)
item.description: Monster Egg Blocks spawn a Silverfish when they are destroyed.

item.name: Stone Bricks
item.description: Stone Bricks are crafted using Stone. Stone Bricks are mainly used in constructions of buildings and paths. Cracked Stone Bricks and Mossy Stone Bricks are a varient of Stone Bricks and can be used instead of Stone Bricks in Item/Block Crafting. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Stone Bricks. They can be found naturaly in Strongholds.

item.name: Mossy Stone Bricks
item.description: Stone Bricks are crafted using Stone. Stone Bricks are mainly used in constructions of buildings and paths. Cracked Stone Bricks and Mossy Stone Bricks are a varient of Stone Bricks and can be used instead of Stone Bricks in Item/Block Crafting. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Stone Bricks. They can be found naturaly in Strongholds.

item.name: Cracked Stone Bricks
item.description: Stone Bricks are crafted using Stone. Stone Bricks are mainly used in constructions of buildings and paths. Cracked Stone Bricks and Mossy Stone Bricks are a varient of Stone Bricks and can be used instead of Stone Bricks in Item/Block Crafting. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Stone Bricks. They can be found naturaly in Strongholds.

item.name: Chiseled Stone Brick
item.description: Stone Bricks are crafted using Stone. Stone Bricks are mainly used in constructions of buildings and paths. Cracked Stone Bricks and Mossy Stone Bricks are a varient of Stone Bricks and can be used instead of Stone Bricks in Item/Block Crafting. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Stone Bricks. They can be found naturaly in Strongholds.

item.name: Brown Mushroom (Block)
item.description: Brown Mushroom (Block)s are part of a Giant Brown Mushroom. Giant Brown Mushrooms can be found naturaly but can also be created by using Bonemeal on a Brown Mushroom. When a Brown Mushroom (Block) is destroyed Brown Mushrooms may be dropped.

item.name: Red Mushroom (Block)
item.description: Red Mushroom (Block)s are part of a Giant Red Mushroom. Giant Red Mushrooms can be found naturaly but can also be created by using Bonemeal on a Red Mushroom. When a Red Mushroom (Block) is destroyed Red Mushrooms may be dropped.

item.name: Iron Bars
item.description: Iron Bars are placed like Fences and change based on the blocks around them. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Iron Bars.

item.name: Glass Pane
item.description: Glass Panes are placed like Fences and change based on the blocks around them. Unlike Glass, they can be picked up once destroyed.

item.name: Melon (Block)
item.description: Melon (Block)s grow from Melon Vines. When destroyed they drop one or more Melon (Slice)s.

item.name: Pumpkin Vine
item.description: Pumpkin Vines are grown from Pumpkin Seeds. A Pumpkin will grow around the Pumpkin Vine if there is a free Farmland or Dirt block next to it. Pumpkin Vines will only spawn a Pumpkin if there are no Pumpkins next to it. When destroyed a Pumpkin Vine drops Pumpkin Seeds.

item.name: Melon Vine
item.description: Melon Vines are grown from Melon Seeds. A Melon (Block) will grow around the Melon Vine if there is a free Farmland or Dirt block next to it. Melon Vines will only spawn a Melon (Block) if there are no Melon (Block)s next to it. When destroyed a Melon Vine drops Melon Seeds.

item.name: Vines
item.description: Vines can be collected using Shears. They can be found in Swamp areas.

item.name: Fence Gate
item.description: Fence Gates allow you to block monsters from entering your fields/gardens. Right Clicking on a gate changes its state from open to closed and visa versa.

item.name: Brick Stairs
item.description: Brick Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Stone Brick Stairs
item.description: Stone Brick Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Mycelium
item.description: Mycelium blocks are found in Mushroom biodomes.

item.name: Lily Pad
item.description: Lily Pads are found in Swamp Biodomes. When destroyed they drop a Lily Pad. They can be placed on top of swamp water.

item.name: Nether Brick
item.description: Nether bricks can be found in Nether Ruins.

item.name: Nether Brick Stairs
item.description: Nether Brick Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Nether Wart
item.description: Nether Warts are grown by sowing Nether Wart Seeds. When a Nether Wart is harvested it has a chance of droping Nether Wart Seeds.

item.name: Enchantment Table
item.description: Enchantment Tables allow you to make Weapons, Tools and Armor more powerful and last longer.To use an Enchantment Table Right Click on it. You will then need to place a Weapon, Tool or Armor in the slot. You can pick 3 random spells from a list to use on your item, each one costs a different amount of Experience.

item.name: Brewing Stand (Block)
item.description: Brewing Stands allow you to create different types of Poitions. To use a Brewing Stand Right Click on it. See Brewing for a list of potion recipes.

item.name: Cauldron (Block)
item.description: Cauldron's can hold Water, allowing you to bring Water to The Nether.

item.name: End Portal
item.description: End Portals transport you to The End, a dimention where Endermen come from.

item.name: End Portal Frame
item.description: End Portal Frames are found naturaly in Strongholds. When all End Portal Frame blocks of a Portal are repaired they will form an End Portal. They can be repaired with Eye of Enders

item.name: End Stone
item.description: End Stone is found in The End dimention. End Stone is dropped when its destroyed. It requires a Wood Pickaxe or higher to destroy.

item.name: Dragon Egg
item.description: Dragon Eggs are dropped by Enderdragons when they are killed. When Right Clicked they teleport a short distance.

item.name: Redstone Lamp
item.description: Redstone Lamps are a powered light source. Unlike Glowstone and Torches you can turn Redstone Lamps on and off.

item.name: Redstone Lamp (On)
item.description: Redstone Lamps are a powered light source. Unlike Glowstone and Torches you can turn Redstone Lamps on and off.

item.name: Oak-Wood Slab (Double)
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Spruce-Wood Slab (Double)
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Birch-Wood Slab (Double)
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Jungle-Wood Slab (Double)
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Acacia Wood Slab (Double)
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Dark Oak Wood Slab (Double)
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Oak-Wood Slab
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Spruce-Wood Slab
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Birch-Wood Slab
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Jungle-Wood Slab
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Acacia Wood Slab
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Dark Oak Wood Slab
item.description: Wooden Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wooden Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Cocoa Plant
item.description: Cocoa Plants grow on the side of Jungle Trees. When destroyed they drop between 1 and 3 Cocoa Beans. You can plant a Cocoa Plant by placing a Cocoa Bean on the side of a Wood (Jungle).

item.name: Sandstone Stairs
item.description: Sandstone Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Emerald Ore
item.description: After being mined, Emerald Ore does not need to be smelted. Emeralds are droped when mined and can be used instantly. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Emerald Ore.

item.name: Ender Chest
item.description: Ender Chests are like the regular chests except that they are a Global storage. When you place items into one Ender Chest, its contents can be accessed via any other Ender Chest in the world.

item.name: Tripwire Hook
item.description: Tripwire forms between two Tripwire Hooks. When a player or mod breaks the tripwire a redstone signal is fired from the two Tripwire Hooks.

item.name: Tripwire
item.description: Tripwire forms between two Tripwire Hooks. When a player or mod breaks the tripwire a redstone signal is fired from the two Tripwire Hooks.

item.name: Block of Emerald
item.description: Emerald Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They are generaly used for Decoration or for storing Emeralds. They can be crafted back into Emeralds. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Emerald Blocks.

item.name: Wooden Stairs (Spruce)
item.description: Wooden Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Wooden Stairs (Birch)
item.description: Wooden Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Wooden Stairs (Jungle)
item.description: Wooden Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Command Block
item.description: Command Blocks fire off a command when a redstone signal is sent to it.

item.name: Beacon
item.description: Becons are used in the construction of Pyramids. By placing one as the top block of a Pyramid consisting of Block of Iron or Block of Gold or Block of Diamond or Block of Emerald you can gain powers when in the range of the Pyramid.

item.name: Flower Pot (Block)
item.description: Flower Pots are a decorative item which can hold plants.

item.name: Carrot (Crop)
item.description: Carrots are grown by sowing Carrots on Farmland. When Carrots are harvested they will drop one or more Carrots. Carrots can be obtained by killing Zombies.

item.name: Potatoes (Crop)
item.description: Potatoes are grown by sowing Potatoes on Farmland. Potatoes can be cooked into Baked Potatoes. When Potatoes are harvested they will drop one or more Potatoes and have a chance of dropping Poisonous Potatoes. Potatoes can be obtained by killing Zombies.

item.name: Button (Wood)
item.description: Wooden Buttons can be used to activate objects like Iron Doors and Redstone Wires. They activate objects for about 1-2 seconds. Wooden Buttons can be pressed by Left Clicking on them. Wooden Buttons activate when hit by Arrows.

item.name: Head Block (Skeleton)
item.description: A decorative Skeleton Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head Block (Wither)
item.description: A decorative Wither Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head Block (Zombie)
item.description: A decorative Zombie Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head Block (Steve)
item.description: A decorative Steve Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head Block (Creeper)
item.description: A decorative Creeper Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Anvil
item.description: Anvils allow you to repair Armor, Weapons and Tools which have durability. Items are repaired by sacrifising a second item of the same type. Enchantments on both items will be combined.

item.name: Anvil (Slightly Damaged)
item.description: Anvils allow you to repair Armor, Weapons and Tools which have durability. Items are repaired by sacrifising a second item of the same type. Enchantments on both items will be combined.

item.name: Anvil (Very Damaged)
item.description: Anvils allow you to repair Armor, Weapons and Tools which have durability. Items are repaired by sacrifising a second item of the same type. Enchantments on both items will be combined.

item.name: Trapped Chest
item.description: Trapped Chests are like regular Chests except that they emit a redstone signal when opened. Allowing a trap to be set off when a player opens the chest.

item.name: Weighted Pressure Plate (Light)
item.description: Weighted Pressure Plates emit a redstone signal when items are dropped on to it. The strength of the redstone signal is based on how many items are on top of it. Weighted Pressure Plate (Light)s require less items on it to emit the strongest redstone signal than the Weighted Pressure Plate (Heavy)s varient.

item.name: Weighted Pressure Plate (Heavy)
item.description: Weighted Pressure Plates emit a redstone signal when items are dropped on to it. The strength of the redstone signal is based on how many items are on top of it. Weighted Pressure Plate (Light)s require less items on it to emit the strongest redstone signal than the Weighted Pressure Plate (Heavy)s varient.

item.name: Redstone Comparator (Off)
item.description: The Redstone Comparator has two modes, Subtraction (when the single back torch is On) and Comparison (when the single back torch is Off). You can change the mode by Right Clicking on the Comparator. It has two inputs, one from the front (A) and one from either side (B). It outputs at the back (Where the single torch is). When in Subtraction mode it will output a redstone signal with the strength of A-B (So if A is 12 and B is 2, it will output a strength of 10). In Comparison mode it will output the strength of A if A is greater or equal to B's strength. If a block which has an inventory (like a Chest) is placed beside either of its inputs (A or B) it will use the amount of space used in the inventory as the signal strength. So if a Chest is full it would output a strength of 15, if empty a strength of 0 and other values if its in between.

item.name: Redstone Comparator (On)
item.description: The Redstone Comparator has two modes, Subtraction (when the single back torch is On) and Comparison (when the single back torch is Off). You can change the mode by Right Clicking on the Comparator. It has two inputs, one from the front (A) and one from either side (B). It outputs at the back (Where the single torch is). When in Subtraction mode it will output a redstone signal with the strength of A-B (So if A is 12 and B is 2, it will output a strength of 10). In Comparison mode it will output the strength of A if A is greater or equal to B's strength. If a block which has an inventory (like a Chest) is placed beside either of its inputs (A or B) it will use the amount of space used in the inventory as the signal strength. So if a Chest is full it would output a strength of 15, if empty a strength of 0 and other values if its in between.

item.name: Daylight Sensor
item.description: Daylight Sensors emit a redstone signal when daylight touches it. The strength of the redstone signal that is emited is based on the light level. Daylight Sensors can be inverted by Right Clicking on them.

item.name: Block of Redstone
item.description: Redstone Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They emit Redstone Power and can be used in conjunction with Pistons to power devices. They can be crafted back into Redstone Dust. An Iron Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Redstone Blocks.

item.name: Nether Quartz Ore
item.description: After being mined, Nether Quartz Ore does not need to be smelted. Nether Quartz are droped when mined and can be used instantly to craft items. A Wooden Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Nether Quartz Ore.

item.name: Hopper
item.description: Any items which fall on to the top of a Hopper are stored in its internal storage. It will also transfer any items inside of its self to adjacent Chests.

item.name: Quartz Stairs
item.description: Quartz Stairs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that need to go up more than one block level. Steps are used in paths that only need to go up one level.

item.name: Rail (Activator)
item.description: Activator Rails activate TNT Minecarts when they pass over them. Activator Rails need to be powered to activate Minecarts.

item.name: Dropper
item.description: Droppers throw out items placed in them when they are triggered by a redstone current. Unlike Dispensers they do not shoot objects like Arrows, allowing them to drop items which a Dispenser can not.

item.name: Leaves (Acacia)
item.description: Leaves can be obtained using Shears on Leaf Blocks of a Tree. They grow when a Sapling turns into a Tree. Destroying Leaves can cause Saplings to drop. Apples have a low chance of dropping when Leaves are destroyed(Birch, Spruce and Jungle Leaves do not drop Apples).

item.name: Leaves (Dark Oak)
item.description: Leaves can be obtained using Shears on Leaf Blocks of a Tree. They grow when a Sapling turns into a Tree. Destroying Leaves can cause Saplings to drop. Apples have a low chance of dropping when Leaves are destroyed(Birch, Spruce and Jungle Leaves do not drop Apples).

item.name: Wood (Acacia Oak)
item.description: Wood can be obtained by attacking Trees. Axes can be used to obtain Wood faster. Wood is generaly crafted into Wooden Planks but can be used as both a building material as well as a Fuel for a Furnace. Logs will burn if near fire or Lava. There are four types of Wood, Oak, Pine, Birch and Jungle.

item.name: Slime Block
item.description: Slime Blocks are created from Slime Ball's which are dropped from Slimes. When a player or mob falls on a Slime Block they bounce.

item.name: Barrier
item.description: Barrier is a block avaliable to adventure map makers. Its an invisible block which blocks player movement. Useful to stop players from going in areas you don't want them to reach. It can only be destroyed in Creative Mode.

item.name: Iron Trapdoor
item.description: Iron Trapdoors work like Iron Doors except that they open upwards. Unlike doors they only take up 1 block in size. Iron Trapdoors are activated by redstone. Water/Lava can not pass through Trapdoors.

item.name: Sea Lantern
item.description: Sea Lanterns are a lightsource which works underwater. It is constantly on.

item.description: Hardened Clay is created by Smelting Clay Blocks in a Furnace. They are used as a building material. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Hardened Clay.

item.name: Block of Coal
item.description: Coal Blocks are man made and are not found naturaly in the World. They have the burning power of 9 Coal, allowing Furnaces to run for longer without needing to be filled up with more Coal. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Coal Ore.

item.name: Inverted Daylight Sensor
item.description: Daylight Sensors emit a redstone signal when daylight touches it. The strength of the redstone signal that is emited is based on the light level. Daylight Sensors can be inverted by Right Clicking on them.

item.name: Red Sandstone (Chiseled)
item.description: Red Sandstones are used in the construction of buildings, walls and paths. A Wood Pickaxe (or Higher) is required to break Sandstone.

item.name: Red Sandstone Stairs

item.name: Red Sandstone Slab (Double)
item.description: Red Sandstone Slabs allow you to get to a higher block level without having to jump. They are generaly used in paths that only go up one level. Cobblestone Stairs or Wood Stairs are used in paths that need to go up more than one block level.

item.name: Wooden Door Block (Spruce)
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Wooden Door Block (Birch)

item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Iron Shovel
item.description: Shovels can destroy Dirt, Gravel and Sand blocks faster than using fists or other tools. The only difference between the shovel types is how meny uses you get out of them and how much damage they deal. Iron Shovels have 129 uses before they break and deal 1.5 Hearts of damage.

item.name: Iron Pickaxe
item.description: Pickaxes can destroy Stone and Ore blocks faster than using fists or other tools. Certain type of Pickaxe are required to harvest the ores. Iron Pickaxes have 129 uses before they break and deals 2 Hearts of damage.Iron Pickaxes can break all block types except Obsidian.

item.name: Iron Axe
item.description: Axes can destroy Log and Wooden Plank blocks faster than using fists or other tools. The only difference between the axe types is how meny uses you get out of them and how much damage they deal. Iron Axes have 129 uses before they break and deal 2.5 Hearts of damage.

item.name: Flint and Steel
item.description: Flint and Steel allows you to set objects in the world on Fire.

item.name: Apple
item.description: Apples can be found in Dungeons. They are also dropped by Leaves. It reduces hunger by 2 when eaten.

item.name: Bow
item.description: Bows are a weapon in Minecraft. Bows require Arrows for ammo and are the only form of ranged weapons in the game. Bows deal 2 Hearts of damage.

item.name: Arrow
item.description: Arrows are used as ammo for Bows. Arrows can be obtained by killing Skeletons or by crafting. If an arrow is shot through lava it will be set on fire.

item.name: Coal
item.description: Coal is mainly used to craft Torches but is also used as fuel for both Furnaces and Powered Minecarts. Coal is dropped when mining Coal Ore.

item.name: Charcoal
item.description: Charcoal is an alternative to Coal. Unlike Coal, Charcoal can be created by the player by smelting Wood in a Furnace. See Coal for more information on what you can use Charcoal for.

item.name: Diamond Gem
item.description: Diamond Gem is dropped when mining Diamond Ore. They are used to create Armor, Weapons and Tools.

item.name: Iron Ingot
item.description: Iron Ingots are created by Smelting Iron Ore in a Furnace. They are used to create Armor, Weapons, Tools and several other items.

item.name: Gold Ingot
item.description: Gold Ingots are created by Smelting Gold Ore in a Furnace. They are used to create Armor, Weapons and Tools.

item.description: Gunpowder is used in crafting TNT. Its dropped by Creepers.

item.name: Wheat Seeds
item.description: Wheat Seeds can be collected by destroying Tall Grass. Wheat Seeds can only be planted in hoed areas. After a few days Wheat can be harvested.

item.name: Wheat
item.description: Wheat is grown by sowing Wheat Seeds. Wheats used to create Bread and Cakes. When Wheat is harvested it has a chance of droping Wheat Seeds. When holding Wheat near by animals will gather around the player. Wheat can be used on animals to make them breed.

item.name: Bread
item.description: Bread is a farmable form of food. It reduces hunger by 2.5 when eaten.

item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Leather Armor can take 49 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Diamond Armor can take 385 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.name: Diamond Boots
item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Diamond Armor can take 385 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.name: Gold Helmet
item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Gold Armor can take 96 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.name: Gold Chestplate
item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Gold Armor can take 96 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.name: Gold Leggings
item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Gold Armor can take 96 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.name: Gold Boots
item.description: While wearing armor you take less damage. The differences between the types of Armor is how much durability it has. Gold Armor can take 96 hits. The more the Armor is damaged the less effective it is at protecting its wearer.

item.name: Flint
item.description: Flint currently has no use other than crafting Arrows and Flint and Steel.

item.name: Raw Porkchop
item.description: Raw Porkchop can be obtained by killing Pigs. Cooked Porkchop has a higher health gain than Raw Porkchop. It reduces hunger by 1.5 when eaten.

item.name: Cooked Porkchop
item.description: Cooked Porkchop is created by cooking Raw Porkchop in a Furnace. Cooked Porkchop has a higher health gain than Raw Porkchop. It reduces hunger by 4 when eaten.

item.name: Painting
item.description: Paintings are a decrative item which display artwork once placed on a wall.

item.name: Golden Apple
item.description: It reduces hunger by 2 when eaten and increases your healing rate for 5 seconds.

item.name: Enchanted Golden Apple
item.description: It reduces hunger by 2 when eaten and increases your healing rate for 30 seconds. Gives both Fire Resistance and Resistance for a duration of 5 minutes.

item.name: Sign
item.description: Signs are a decorative item that allows you to place a Sign with a custom message in the world. If you are looking at the ground when you place the Sign, it will have a pole. If you are looking at a wall when you place it, it will become a wall mounted Sign. Signs are mainly used in Multiplayer to inform other players where places are or to inform people who buildings belong to.

item.name: Wooden Door
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Bucket
item.description: Buckets can hold either Lava, Milk or Water. To pick up Lava or Water right click on an existing block. To obtain Milk right click on a Cow. To place right click on an empty spot.

item.name: Bucket (Water)
item.description: Buckets can hold either Lava, Milk or Water. To pick up Lava or Water right click on an existing block. To obtain Milk right click on a Cow. To place right click on an empty spot.

item.name: Bucket (Lava)
item.description: Buckets can hold either Lava, Milk or Water. To pick up Lava or Water right click on an existing block. To obtain Milk right click on a Cow. To place right click on an empty spot.

item.name: Minecart
item.description: Minecarts are a form of transportation which can carry both the player as well as animals. To ride in a Minecart you need to right click on it. Minecarts have no engine and require either gravity or a Powered Minecart to push them along a track.

item.name: Saddle
item.description: A Saddle allows you to ride certain mobs. Currently only Pigs and Horses are rideable. Once a Saddle is used it can not be retrieved.

item.name: Iron Door
item.description: Iron Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on an Iron Door does not change its open/closed state. The only way to open or close an iron door is via Levers, Stone Buttons, Wood Pressure Plate, Stone Pressure Plates and Redstone Torchs.

item.name: Redstone Dust
item.description: Redstone Dust is droped when mining Redstone Ore. Redstone Dust does not need to be smelted to be used in crafting. Redstone Dust can be used to create Redstone Wires by placing it on the ground with Right Click.

item.name: Snowball
item.description: Snowballs can be obtained by destroying a Snow Block or from collecting snow from the surface of blocks using a Shovel. Snowballs can be thrown by the player, but they deal no damage. They do however push mobs back when hit.

item.name: Boat
item.description: Boats allow you to travel on water at speed. If they are crashed they break and drop Sticks and Wooden Planks. To enter a Boat Right Click on it. To exit a Boat Right Click outside the Boat. You can use the movement keys to move Boats. Boats can only be used on Water.

item.name: Leather
item.description: Leather is used to craft other items. It is droped by Cows.

item.name: Bucket (Milk)
item.description: Milk can be obtained from Cows by right clicking on them while you have a Bucket equiped. Milk currently can only be used to make Cakes.

item.name: Clay Brick
item.description: Clay Bricks are formed by smelting Clay in a Furnace. There only use is to create Brick.

item.name: Clay
item.description: Clay is obtained by destroying Clay Blocks. Clay can be crafted back into a Clay Block or it can be turned into Clay Bricks by smelting them in a Furnace.

item.name: Sugar Cane
item.description: Sugar Cane require dirt under them and water beside them. They won't grow if there is no room above them. Sugar Canes can grow to 3 blocks high. If the lowest part of the Sugar Cane is destroyed the Sugar Cane above will also be destroyed allowing for quicker harvesting.

item.name: Paper
item.description: Paper currently has no use other than crafting Books.

item.name: Book
item.description: Books can be crafted into Bookcases or a Book and Quill.

item.name: Slime Ball
item.description: Slime Balls are dropped by Slimes. They are used in Sticky Pistons and Slime Blocks.

item.name: Minecart (Storage)
item.description: Storage Minecarts allow you to transport items via tracks. Storage Minecarts have no engine and require either gravity or a Powered Minecart to push them along a track.

item.name: Minecart (Powered)
item.description: Powered Minecarts can push other minecarts. They require fuel before they will work. To give a powered minecart fuel you need to equip Coal and then right click on the Powered Minecart. To get the Powered Minecart to go in a different direction, face the way you wish the Powered Minecart to go and right click on it.

item.name: Egg
item.description: Eggs are dropped by Chickens randomly. They are only used in creating Cakes. When thrown (By the player or via a Dispencer) they will spawn a Chicken where they land.

item.name: Compass
item.description: A Compass allways points to your spawn point. It allows you to create paths back to spawn so that if you die you will be able to get back to your buildings easily.

item.name: Fishing Rod
item.description: Fishing Rods are used to catch Raw Fish. To begin fishing you need to Right Click to cast the line. When the bobber starts bobbing Right Click to reel the Raw Fish in. If you are fast enough a Raw Fish will fly out of the Water and land near you.

item.name: Watch
item.description: Watches are the only way to tell the time in Minecraft. They have a picture of the sun and moon which rotates showing how much of the day or night has past.

item.name: Glowstone Dust
item.description: Glowstone Dust is droped by breaking Glowstone. Its only use is to create Glowstone blocks.

item.name: Raw Fish
item.description: Raw Fish can be caught using a Fishing Rod on Water. It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten. Raw Fish can be cooked in a Furnace to produce Cooked Fish.

item.name: Raw Salmon
item.description: Raw Fish can be caught using a Fishing Rod on Water. It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten. Raw Fish can be cooked in a Furnace to produce Cooked Fish.

item.name: Clownfish
item.description: Raw Fish can be caught using a Fishing Rod on Water. It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten. Raw Fish can be cooked in a Furnace to produce Cooked Fish.

item.name: Pufferfish
item.description: Raw Fish can be caught using a Fishing Rod on Water. It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten. Raw Fish can be cooked in a Furnace to produce Cooked Fish.

item.name: Cooked Fish
item.description: Cooked Fish are created by cooking Raw Fish in a Furnace. It reduces hunger by 2.5 when eaten.

item.name: Cooked Salmon
item.description: Cooked Fish are created by cooking Raw Fish in a Furnace. It reduces hunger by 2.5 when eaten.

item.name: Clownfish
item.description: Raw Fish can be caught using a Fishing Rod on Water. It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten. Raw Fish can be cooked in a Furnace to produce Cooked Fish.

item.name: Pufferfish
item.description: Raw Fish can be caught using a Fishing Rod on Water. It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten. Raw Fish can be cooked in a Furnace to produce Cooked Fish.

item.name: Ink Sack
item.description: Ink Sacks can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Black colour. They are dropped by Squids.

item.name: Rose Red Dye
item.description: Rose Red Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Red colour.

item.name: Cactus Green Dye
item.description: Cactus Green Dye is made by placing Cactus in a Furnace. It can be used to dye Wool and Sheep a Green colour.

item.name: Cocoa Bean
item.description: Cocoa Beans are found in Dungeons and are dropped when destroying a Cocoa Plant. Cocoa Bean can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Brown colour as well as make Cookies. You can plant a Cocoa Plant by placing a Cocoa Bean on the side of a Wood (Jungle).

item.name: Lapis Lazuli
item.description: Lapis Lazuli can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Blue colour.

item.name: Purple Dye
item.description: Purple Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Purple colour.

item.name: Cyan Dye
item.description: Cyan Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Cyan colour.

item.name: Light Gray Dye
item.description: Light Gray Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Light Gray colour.

item.name: Gray Dye
item.description: Gray Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Gray colour.

item.name: Pink Dye
item.description: Pink Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Pink colour.

item.name: Lime Dye
item.description: Lime Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Lime colour.

item.name: Dandelion Yellow Dye
item.description: Dandelion Yellow Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Yellow colour.

item.name: Light Blue Dye
item.description: Light Blue Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Light Blue colour.

item.name: Magenta Dye
item.description: Magenta Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Magenta colour.

item.name: Orange Dye
item.description: Orange Dye can be used to Dye Sheep and Wool a Orange colour.

item.name: Bone Meal
item.description: Bone Meal is used in the creation of Dyes, which can then be used on Wool and Sheep. Bone Meal turns coloured Sheep to White. Bone Meal can be used on Saplings, Wheat, Grass, Red Mushrooms and Brown Mushrooms to make them grow instantly.

item.name: Bone
item.description: Bones are dropped by Skeletons and are used to create Bone Meal. When Dirt is destroyed there is a small chance that a Bone will be dropped.

item.name: Sugar
item.description: Sugar's only use is in creating Cakes.

item.name: Cake
item.description: Cake can only be eaten once it has been placed on the ground by Right Clicking. Once placed the player can eat 6 slices of Cake which reduces hunger by 1 each time. It reduces hunger by 6 when fully consumed.

item.name: Bed
item.description: Beds allow the player to sleep until the morning. They can only be used at night. In a multiplayer server only if all players are in a bed will the servers time change to morning. Sleeping in a bed changes your respawn point to the beds location.

item.name: Redstone Repeater
item.description: Redstone Repeater's are designed to repeat the current they recieve. They remove the need to use two not gates to extend a redstone current. They only accept input from one side.

item.name: Cookie
item.description: Cookies are craftable form of food. It reduces hunger by 0.5 when eaten.

item.name: Map
item.description: When you hold an Empty Map it is filled in with the surrounding area and turned into a Map. Any changes players make to the world will not be reflected in your map unless you visit areas which were changed again. Maps have a limited area that they cover. You can clone Maps by crafting a filled in Map with an Empty Map.

item.name: Shears
item.description: Shears allow you to obtain Wool by using them on Sheep. Using Shears on a Sheep will cause them no damage. You can also obtain Leaves, Vines and Tall Grass by using Shears on them.

item.name: Melon (Slice)
item.description: Melon Slices come from destroying a Melon (Block). It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten.

item.name: Pumpkin Seeds
item.description: Pumpkin Seeds can only be planted in hoed areas. After a few days they will grow into a Pumpkin Vine.

item.name: Melon Seeds
item.description: Melon Seeds can only be planted in hoed areas. After a few days they will grow into a Melon Vine.

item.name: Raw Beef
item.description: Raw Beef can be obtained by killing Cows. Steak has a higher health gain than Raw Beef. You gain ? It reduces hunger by 1.5 when eaten.

item.name: Steak
item.description: Steak is created by cooking Raw Beef in a Furnace. It reduces hunger by 4 when eaten.

item.name: Raw Chicken
item.description: Raw Chicken can be obtained by killing Chickens. Cooked Chicken has a higher health gain than Raw Chicken. Raw Chicken can poison you if eaten. You gain ? It reduces hunger by 1 when eaten.

item.name: Cooked Chicken
item.description: Cooked Chicken is created by cooking Raw Chicken in a Furnace. It reduces hunger by 3 when eaten.

item.name: Rotten Flesh
item.description: It reduces hunger by 2 and poisons the player when eaten. Zombies drop rotten flesh when they die.

item.name: Ender Pearl
item.description: Right clicking while holding an Ender Pearl will transport the player to the location it is thrown to. When used it causes 5 damage to the player. They are dropped by Endermen.

item.name: Blaze Rod
item.description: Blaze Rods are dropped by Blazes.

item.name: Ghast Tear
item.description: Ghast Tears are dropped by Ghasts. They are used in Brewing Potions.

item.name: Gold Nugget
item.description: Gold Nuggets are dropped by Zombie Pigmen. They can be crafted into Gold Ingots.

item.name: Nether Wart Seeds
item.description: Nether Wart Seeds can only be planted on Soul Sand. After a few days Nether Warts can be harvested. When a Nether Wart is harvested it has a chance of droping Nether Wart Seeds.

item.name: Water Bottle
item.description: Water Bottles can be used to create potions. You can create a Water Bottle by using a Glass Bottle on Water. You can create potions using a Brewing Stand. See Brewing for a list of recipies.

item.name: Awkward Potion
item.description: Awkward Potion is a base potion. It has no use by its self but can be used to craft other potions.

item.name: Thick Potion
item.description: Thick Potion is a base potion. It has no use by its self but can be used to craft other potions.

item.name: Mundane Potion
item.description: Mundane Potion is a base potion. It has no use by its self but can be used to craft other potions.

item.name: Regeneration Potion (0:45)
item.description: Regeneration Potion (0:45) increases you regeneration rate for 45 seconds.

item.name: Swiftness Potion (3:00)
item.description: When consumed Swiftness Potion (3:00) will make the player move faster and jump further for 3 minutes.

item.name: Fire Resistance Potion (3:00)
item.description: Fire Resistance Potion (3:00) will protect you from taking Fire and Lava damage for 3 minutes.

item.name: Poison Potion (0:45)
item.description: When consumed Poison Potion (0:45) will poison the player for 45 seconds.

item.name: Healing Potion
item.description: When consumed Healing Potion will heal the player by 3 hearts.

item.name: Night Vision Potion (3:00)
item.description: When consumed Night Vision Potion (3:00) will give the player Night Vision for 3 minutes.

item.name: Weakness Potion (1:30)
item.description: When consumed Weakness Potion (1:30) will make the players attacks less powerful for 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: Strength Potion (3:00)
item.description: When consumed Strength Potion (3:00) will make the players attacks stronger for 3 minutes.

item.name: Slowness Potion (1:30)
item.description: When consumed Slowness Potion (1:30) will make the player move slower and jump shorter for 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: Harming Potion
item.description: When consumed Harming Potion will damage the player by 3 hearts.

item.name: Water Breathing Potion (3:00)
item.description: When consumed Water Breathing Potion (3:00) will allow the player to breathe underwater for 3 minutes.

item.name: Invisibility Potion (3:00)
item.description: When consumed Invisibility Potion (3:00) will make the player invisible.

item.description: Regeneration Potion (0:22) increases you regeneration rate for 22 seconds.

item.description: When consumed Swiftness Potion II (1:30) will make the player move faster and jump further for 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: Poison Potion II (0:22)
item.description: When consumed Poison Potion (0:22) will poison the player for 22 seconds.

item.description: When consumed Healing Potion II will heal the player by 6 hearts.

item.description: When consumed Strength Potion II (1:30) will make the players attacks stronger for 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: Leaping Potion II (1:30)
item.description: When consumed Leaping Potion II (1:30) will make the player jump higher for 1 minute 30 seconds.

item.name: Harming Potion II
item.description: When consumed Harming Potion II will damage the player by 6 hearts.

item.description: Regeneration Potion (2:00) increases you regeneration rate for 2 minutes.

item.description: When consumed Night Vision Potion (8:00) will give the player Night Vision for 8 minutes.

item.name: Weakness Potion (4:00)
item.description: When consumed Weakness Potion (4:00) will make the players attacks less powerful for 4 minute 0 seconds.

item.name: Strength Potion (8:00)
item.description: When consumed Strength Potion (8:00) will make the players attacks stronger for 8 minutes.

item.name: Slowness Potion (4:00)
item.description: When consumed Slowness Potion (4:00) will make the player move slower and jump shorter for 4 minutes.

item.name: Leaping Potion (3:00)
item.description: When consumed Leaping Potion (3:00) will make the player jump higher for 3 minutes.
