item.name: Invisibility Potion (8:00)
item.description: When consumed Invisibility Potion (8:00) will make the player invisible.

item.name: Regeneration Potion II (1:00)
item.description: Regeneration Potion (1:00) increases you regeneration rate for 1 minute. This potion can only be obtained through spawning. This potion can only be obtained through spawning.

item.name: Swiftness Potion II (4:00)
item.description: When consumed Swiftness Potion II (4:00) will make the player move faster and jump further for 4 minutes. This potion can only be obtained through spawning.

item.name: Poison Potion II (1:00)
item.description: When consumed Poison Potion (1:00) will poison the player for 1 minutes. This potion can only be obtained through spawning.

item.name: Strength Potion II (4:00)
item.description: When consumed Strength Potion II (4:00) will make the players attacks stronger for 4 minutes.

item.name: Regeneration Splash (0:33)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Regeneration Splash Potions will increases the regeneration rate of anything they cover.

item.name: Swiftness Splash (2:15)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Swiftness Splash Potions will increase the speed and jump distance of anything they cover.

item.name: Fire Resistance Splash (2:15)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Fire Resistance Splash Potions protect anything they cover from taking Fire and Lava damage.

item.name: Poison Splash (0:33)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Poison Splash Potions will poison anything they cover.

item.name: Healing Splash
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Healing Splash Potions will heal anything they cover by 2 hearts.

item.name: Night Vision Splash (2:15)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Invisibility Splash Potions will give anything they cover Night Vision.

item.name: Weakness Splash (1:07)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Weakness Splash Potions will decrease the attack damage of anything they cover.

item.name: Strength Splash (2:15)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Strength Splash Potions will increase the attack damage of anything they cover.

item.name: Slowness Splash (1:07)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Slowness Splash Potions will reduce the speed and jump distance of anything they cover.

item.name: Harming Splash
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Harming Splash Potions will damage anything they cover by 2 hearts.

item.name: Breathing Splash (2:15)
item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Water Breathing Splash (2:15) allows the player to breathe underwater for 2 minutes and 15 seconds.

item.description: Splash Potions break when thrown and cover players/mobs with there contents. Invisibility Splash Potions will make anything they cover invisible.

item.name: Glass Bottle
item.description: Glass Bottles are used in crafting Potions. You can create a Water Bottle by using it on Water.

item.name: Spider Eye
item.description: Spider Eyes have a chance of dropping when a Cave Spider or Spider dies. When eaten they poison the player.

item.name: Fermented Spider Eye
item.description: Fermented Spider Eyes are used in Brewing Potions.

item.name: Blaze Powder
item.description: Blaze Powder can be used to craft other items.

item.name: Magma Cream
item.description: Magma Cream is used in Brewing Potions.

item.name: Brewing Stand
item.description: Brewing Stands allow you to create different types of Poitions. To use a Brewing Stand Right Click on it. See Brewing for a list of potion recipes.

item.name: Cauldron
item.description: Cauldron's can hold Water, allowing you to bring Water to The Nether.

item.name: Eye of Ender
item.description: Eye of Ender's can be used to repair End Portal Frame Blocks.

item.name: Glistering Melon (Slice)
item.description: Glistering Melon (Slice)'s can be used to make Healing Potions.

item.name: Spawn Egg (Creeper)
item.description: Spawn Eggs allow you to spawn Mobs by right clicking on the ground while they are in your hands. You can also use them in Dispencers. Hostile mobs will instantly de-spawn if the difficulty is on Peaceful.

item.name: Spawn Egg (Skeleton)
item.description: Spawn Eggs allow you to spawn Mobs by right clicking on the ground while they are in your hands. You can also use them in Dispencers. Hostile mobs will instantly de-spawn if the difficulty is on Peaceful.

item.name: Bottle of Enchanting
item.description: Bottle of Enchanting's act like a splash potion. When dropped they spawn Experience Orbs which can be collected by players.

item.name: Fire Charge
item.description: Fire Charge's can be used in Dispencers to fire Blaze like fireballs, like a Blazes fireball they will travel in a straight line until they hit something. They can also be used like Flint and Steel but are destroyed after only one use.

item.name: Book and Quill
item.description: The Book and Quill allow players to write there own books.

item.name: Written Book
item.description: Written Books are player created books. They are created when a Book and Quill is signed and can not be edited.

item.name: Emerald
item.description: Emeralds is dropped when mining Emerald Ore. They are used in Trading with villagers.

item.name: Item Frame
item.description: Item Frames are like Paintings but they can hold an object inside of them. You can place most of the items/blocks in the game into an Item Frame such as Maps, Weapons, Etc.

item.name: Flower Pot
item.description: Flower Pots are a decorative item which can hold plants.

item.name: Carrot
item.description: Carrots are grown by sowing Carrots on Farmland. When Carrots are harvested they will drop one or more Carrots. Carrots can be obtained by killing Zombies.

item.name: Potato
item.description: Potatoes are grown by sowing Potatoes on Farmland. Potatoes can be cooked into Baked Potatoes. When Potatoes are harvested they will drop one or more Potatoes and have a chance of dropping Poisonous Potatoes. Potatoes can be obtained by killing Zombies.

item.name: Baked Potato
item.description: Baked Potatoes reduce the players hunger more than Potatoes.

item.name: Poisonous Potato
item.description: Poisonous Potatoes will poison the player on consumption. They are obtained when harvesting Potatoes.

item.name: Empty Map
item.description: When you hold an Empty Map it is filled in with the surrounding area and turned into a Map. Any changes players make to the world will not be reflected in your map unless you visit areas which were changed again. Maps have a limited area that they cover. You can clone Maps by crafting a filled in Map with an Empty Map.

item.name: Golden Carrot
item.description: Golden Carrots main use is creating Night Vision Potions but can be eaten to reduce hunger by 3.

item.name: Head (Skeleton)
item.description: A decorative Skeleton Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head (Wither)
item.description: A decorative Wither Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head (Zombie)
item.description: A decorative Zombie Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head (Steve)
item.description: A decorative Steve Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Head (Creeper)
item.description: A decorative Creeper Head which can be placed or used as a helmet.

item.name: Carrot on a Stick
item.description: Carrot on a Stick allows you to control a Pig which is equiped with a Saddle.

item.name: Pumpkin Pie
item.description: Pumpkin Pies reduce your hunger by 4 when eaten. Pumpkin Pies can be stacked.

item.name: Firework Rocket
item.description: Firework Rockets can be activated by holding them and Right Clicking on the ground. They can also be used in Dispencers. When activated they will fire into the sky and explode. Different Firework Stars produce different effects. Firework Rockets can be made with either 1, 2 or 3 Gunpowder depending on how high you want the rocket to go before it explodes.

item.name: Firework Star
item.description: Firework Stars control what effects happen when a Firework Rocket explodes. Diamond Gems can be added to the Firework Stars recipe to add a Trail effect to them and Glowstone can be added to add a Twinkle effect to them.

item.name: Enchanted Book
item.description: Enchanted Books are created by using a Book in an Enchantment Table. You can then use them in an Anvil to apply enchantments.

item.name: Redstone Comparator
item.description: The Redstone Comparator has two modes, Subtraction (when the single back torch is On) and Comparison (when the single back torch is Off). You can change the mode by Right Clicking on the Comparator. It has two inputs, one from the front (A) and one from either side (B). It outputs at the back (Where the single torch is). When in Subtraction mode it will output a redstone signal with the strength of A-B (So if A is 12 and B is 2, it will output a strength of 10). In Comparison mode it will output the strength of A if A is greater or equal to B's strength. If a block which has an inventory (like a Chest) is placed beside either of its inputs (A or B) it will use the amount of space used in the inventory as the signal strength. So if a Chest is full it would output a strength of 15, if empty a strength of 0 and other values if its in between.

item.name: Nether Brick (Item)
item.description: Nether Brick (Item)s are formed by smelting Netherrack in a Furnace. There only use is to create Nether Brick.

item.name: Nether Quartz
item.description: Nether Quartz is obtained by smelting Nether Quartz Ore. It is used in crafting other items.

item.name: Minecart (TNT)
item.description: TNT Minecarts are activated when they go over a powered Activator Rail.

item.name: Minecart (Hopper)
item.description: Hopper Minecarts suck items out of adjacent Chests and items laying on the track it goes over.

item.name: Rabbit Stew
item.description: Rabbit Stew can not be harvested and must be crafted. It reduces hunger by 10 when eaten.

item.name: Rabbit Hide
item.description: Rabbit Hide is used to craft other items. It is droped by Rabbits.

item.name: Lead
item.description: Leashes allow you to tie friendly Mobs to Fence posts as well as lead them about. Right Click on a friendly Mob to attach the leash to it. You need to use a second Leash to tie it to a Fence post.

item.name: Name Tag
item.description: Name Tags allow you to re-name Mobs. You need to use the Name Tag in an Anvil to add a name to the tag. Once it has a name set Right Click on the Mob you want to re-name. Name Tags can be found in Dungeon Chests.

item.name: Minecart (Command Block)
item.description: Minecart Command Blocks fire off a command when they go over an Activator Rail.

item.name: Wooden Door (Spruce)
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Wooden Door (Birch)
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Wooden Door (Jungle)
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Wooden Door (Acacia)
item.description: Wooden Doors allow you to block monsters from entering your building. Clicking on a door changes its state from open to closed and visa versa. Wooden Doors can be opened/closed via Redstone Circuits.

item.name: Music Disk (13)
item.description: Music Disks are droped when a Skeleton kills a Creeper with its Arrows. They can also be found in dungeons. To use a Music Disk you need to put them in a Jukebox.
